North_Charleston.Farmers' and Exchange Bank: The Farmers' and Exchange Bank is a historic commercial building at 141 East Bay Street in Charleston, South Carolina. Built in 1853–54, it is an architecturally distinctive building, with Moorish Revival features rarely seen in the United States. The building is recognizable for its use of muqarnas—characteristic of Persian and North African architecture—as well as its large arched windows and striking red sandstone facade.
